prop.name: about
prop.desc: The subject matter of the content.

prop.name: funder
prop.desc: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

prop.name: workFeatured
prop.desc:
A work featured in some event, e.g. exhibited in an ExhibitionEvent.
       Specific subproperties are available for workPerformed (e.g. a play), or a workPresented (a Movie at a ScreeningEvent).

prop.name: audience
prop.desc: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

prop.name: remainingAttendeeCapacity
prop.desc: The number of attendee places for an event that remain unallocated.

prop.name: actor
prop.desc: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

prop.name: performers
prop.desc: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor.

prop.name: endDate
prop.desc: The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

prop.name: doorTime
prop.desc: The time admission will commence.

prop.name: contributor
prop.desc: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

prop.name: maximumAttendeeCapacity
prop.desc: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

prop.name: typicalAgeRange
prop.desc: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

prop.name: organizer
prop.desc: An organizer of an Event.

prop.name: attendees
prop.desc: A person attending the event.

prop.name: aggregateRating
prop.desc: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

prop.name: subEvent
prop.desc: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference.

prop.name: subEvents
prop.desc: Events that are a part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each subEvents of the conference.

prop.name: offers
prop.desc: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

prop.name: inLanguage
prop.desc: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also availableLanguage.

prop.name: attendee
prop.desc: A person or organization attending the event.

prop.name: workPerformed
prop.desc: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.

prop.name: eventStatus
prop.desc: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.

prop.name: startDate
prop.desc: The start date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

prop.name: director
prop.desc: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

prop.name: superEvent
prop.desc: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.

prop.name: duration
prop.desc: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

prop.name: translator
prop.desc: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

prop.name: previousStartDate
prop.desc: Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

prop.name: review
prop.desc: A review of the item.

prop.name: sponsor
prop.desc: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

prop.name: location
prop.desc: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

prop.name: recordedIn
prop.desc: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event.

prop.name: composer
prop.desc: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

prop.name: isAccessibleForFree
prop.desc: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

prop.name: performer
prop.desc: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.

Thing.name: sameAs
Thing.desc: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

Thing.name: image
Thing.desc: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

Thing.name: additionalType
Thing.desc: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

Thing.name: identifier
Thing.desc: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

Thing.name: potentialAction
Thing.desc: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

Thing.name: mainEntityOfPage
Thing.desc: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.

Thing.name: disambiguatingDescription
Thing.desc: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.
